abstract: The company dropped the sale price of its commercial supply business by nearly $2 billion, one of the first big buyouts renegotiated amid the credit squeeze.
snippet: The company dropped the sale price of its commercial supply business by nearly $2 billion, one of the first big buyouts renegotiated amid the credit squeeze.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot was forced to drop the sale price of its commercial supply business by nearly $2 billion yesterday, according to people involved in the negotiations, one of the first big buyouts to be renegotiated as a result of the recent tightening of credit and problems in the housing market.

headline.main: Home Depot Unit Sees Price Drop in Tight Market
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Unit Sees Price Plunge In Tight Market

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: To save its struggling deal, Home Depot was forced to drop the sale price of its commercial supply business by nearly $2 billion yesterday, according to The New York Times, becoming one of the first big buyouts to be renegotiated as a result of the recent tightening of credit and problems in the housing market.
lead_paragraph: To save its struggling deal, Home Depot was forced to drop the sale price of its commercial supply business by nearly $2 billion yesterday, according to The New York Times, becoming one of the first big buyouts to be renegotiated as a result of the recent tightening of credit and problems in the housing market.

headline.main: Price for Home Depot Unit Plunges in a Tight Market

abstract: Shares in Home Depot rose 1.9 percent to $35.33 in afternoon trading Monday on news that the sale of the company’s wholesale supply unit, HD Supply, is still on track. The retailing giant agreed to trim the price to $8.5 billion as it prepares to sell the unit to Bain Capital, the Carlyle Group and Clayton Dubilier & Rice.
lead_paragraph: Shares in Home Depot rose 1.9 percent to $35.33 in afternoon trading Monday on news that the sale of the company’s wholesale supply unit, HD Supply, is still on track. The retailing giant agreed to trim the price to $8.5 billion as it prepares to sell the unit to Bain Capital, the Carlyle Group and Clayton Dubilier & Rice.

headline.main: Home Depot Shares Rise as Deal Is Repriced

abstract: Will the drama at HD Supply spawn any sequels?
lead_paragraph: Will the drama at HD Supply spawn any sequels?

headline.main: Home Depot: A Script for Deal Renegotiations?
